text: LAMP sensitivity was assessed by the detection of ten RoundUp Ready [UNK] GMO targets in a background of 100 ng of genomic oilseed rape DNA ( Figure 3 ) . Since the C value of both species is approximately 1 pg [ 12 ] , this background DNA represents a GMO level of 0 . 01 % for both Tnos and P - 35S assays . OSR DNA was used because we did not have any soya DNA free from RoundUp Ready [UNK] . DNA extracted from our 0 % CRM was shown to contain 0 . 002 % GMO [ 13 ] . The use of 100 ng of this sample would be equivalent to adding 200 copies of the transgene sequence , considerably more than the experimental input of 10 copies . We believe the use of OSR DNA to be a valid substitute since none of the primer sequences for either assay will be present in non - transgenic soya or oilseed rape .
